description: Découvrez les meilleurs hôtels à Hobart, Australia. Trouvez des offres exclusives et des hébergements de luxe.

hotels.title: Boutique Hobart Heritage City Break with Daily Breakfast
hotels.description: Stay on the northern fringes of the capital in one of Tasmania's most significant heritage properties, dating back to 1887. With the city centre just a short drive away, this heavenly escape places you close to top-notch restaurants, vibrant bars, impressive galleries and museums, with enough distance to feel as if you’re worlds away from the everyday. Stretching across three expansive levels, this elegant lodge offers guests cosy sitting rooms with crackling fireplaces and views that stretch across Hobart to kunanyi / Mount Wellington. This charming boutique lodge is where refined luxury meets the tranquillity of nature.

hotels.title: Adults-Only Boutique Hobart Retreat with Spectacular Mount Wellington Views
hotels.description: Built in 1847, the Islington Hotel's historic charm and cosy vibes offer the perfect place to rejuvenate, surrounded by picture-perfect Mount Wellington views, precious artworks, crackling fires and sun-drenched terraces. After indulging in a decadent breakfast, experience the grandeur, natural beauty and charm of the capital city, home to a vibrant live music scene, dramatic art galleries and gourmet dining options.

hotels.title: Stylish Vibe Hobart Stay Moments from the Harbour & Salamanca Market
hotels.description: Fall in love with the Apple Isle's many charms at Vibe Hotel Hobart, a unique property just a short walk from the harbour. With its towering, sophisticated exterior and sleek modern décor, you’d never guess that the historic building dates back to the 1930s, when it was better known as the Belvedere Ballroom. Stroll to the harbourfront, where Salamanca Market buzzes with tourists and locals every Saturday, or catch the ferry from Constitution Dock to MONA, Hobart's most eclectic art gallery - home to interactive exhibitions, fine dining and even a winery. At the end of each day, Vibe's impeccable hospitality and stunning fifth-floor heated pool are waiting to welcome you home.

hotels.title: Waterfront Mövenpick City Break in the Heart of Hobart with Onsite Gourmet Dining
hotels.description: Soak up the allure of Tasmania's capital from this sophisticated Mövenpick sanctuary ideally positioned in the heart of Hobart's vibrant waterfront precinct. Take this chance to discover Hobart's rich culture, history and lip-smacking cuisine as you explore the iconic Salamanca Market, stroll the harbour and admire the Royal Tasmanian Botanical Gardens. Back at your hotel, unwind in your plush room and when hunger strikes, indulge in a culinary journey at the onsite Tesoro Modern Italian Restaurant sampling local dry-aged meats and house-made tiramisu. For art enthusiasts, the world-renowned Museum of Old and New Art is only a short ferry ride - or 20-minute drive - away and awaits exploration.

hotels.title: Hobart Waterfront Luxury Five Minutes from Salamanca with Nine Restaurants & Bars
hotels.description: Experience the history, natural beauty and lively vibe of Hobart with a stay at Wrest Point. Delight in the breathtaking views of the Derwent River, Mount Wellington and the city from your elegant accommodation, before setting out to explore all that the capital has to offer, including Salamanca Market, historic Battery Point and the renowned Museum of Old and New Art (MONA). You'll be spoilt for culinary choice with nine restaurants and bars onsite, including The Point Revolving Restaurant, perched on the 17th floor. When not eating or drinking, take dips in the indoor pool, or soak up the thrilling entertainment at the casino or Entertainment Centre.

hotels.title: Stylish City Break in the Heart of Hobart with Rooftop Bar
hotels.description: Escape to the heart of Hobart with a stay at Crowne Plaza Hobart, an IHG Hotel, masterfully positioned on Liverpool Street near a bustling collection of cafés, boutiques and historic theatres. Admire stunning views of mighty Mt. Wellington over espressotinis at rooftop bar The Deck or feast on grilled, market-fresh seafood at Core restaurant and bar, serving seasonal plates backed by Tasmania's succulent local produce - a shining example of what makes Hobart’s culinary culture so brilliant.

hotels.title: Hobart Waterfront Art Hotel with Onsite Dining & Cocktail Bar
hotels.description: Australia’s first dedicated art hotel combines luxury hospitality and creative expression, housed in a historic jam factory on Hobart’s bustling waterfront. With exposed brick, steel beams and soaring ceilings, the building’s industrial character is elevated by contemporary details and an impressive art collection from Tasmanian creatives. Perfectly positioned in the heart of Hobart, spend your days exploring the colonial-era streets, award-winning restaurants and the stunning riverside, or perhaps dive deeper into the hotel’s collection on their Art and History Tour. Indulge in Tasmania’s finest produce at Landscape Restaurant & Grill and cheers to your stay with a handcrafted cocktail at IXL Long Bar.

hotels.title: Acclaimed Hobart Hotel on the Historic Macquarie Wharf with Waterfront Restaurant & Three Bars
hotels.description: Experience a hotel that feels like a luxury cruise, not just a city stay, all within walking distance of Hobart’s best. Situated on the city’s most historic wharf, boasting timber panelling, sweeping windows and subtle reminders of its storied past, it’s impossible not to be wowed by the seaside splendour of the iconic MACq 01 Hotel. After days of uncovering Hobart’s wonders, retreat to your designer room, each embodying the storied Tasmanian spirit through quirky artwork, raw materials and earthy tones. Later, savour freshly caught Tasmanian seafood at Old Wharf Restaurant, with a backdrop of the dazzling harbour, before a nightcap by The Lounge's open fire.

hotels.title: Stylish Central Hobart Stay Moments From Salamanca Markets
hotels.description: Experience the charm of Tasmania's capital with a central stay located in the heart of Hobart's bustling waterfront district. This contemporary hotel is within easy reach of the city's renowned Salamanca Market, historic Battery Point and the Tasmanian Museum and Art Gallery. Start each morning at Cafe Collins, before embracing all that the southern capital has to offer, including the Royal Botanic Gardens and the Museum of Old and New Art (MONA). Return each night to impeccable hospitality and cosy cloud-like beds.

hotels.title: Hobart Waterfront Escape with Skyline-View Heated Indoor Pool
hotels.description: Experience the very best of Tasmania's capital with a stay in the heart of the thriving harbourfront city at Hotel Grand Chancellor Hobart, located on the postcard-perfect waterfront. Relax and enjoy the view before heading out to hop between cosy cafes, fabulous restaurants and lively bars. Return to the welcoming hotel and make the most of its world-class facilities, including a heated indoor pool with incredible skyline views.

hotels.title: Heritage-Listed Rydges Hobart Stay within Minutes of Salamanca Wharf
hotels.description: Escape to Tasmania's historic capital with a stylish stay at the heritage-listed Rydges Hobart - a charming retreat in the trendy neighbourhood of North Hobart. Sneak away for a relaxing escape in a magical destination packed with world-class art, epicurean discoveries, one-of-a-kind cafés, indulgent wine and cocktail bars and picturesque cobblestone streets, all perched on the edge of a beautiful harbour. When you return after a day of exploring, dine at 1898 Restaurant and Bar, set within the historic main building with a fireplace and courtyard.

hotels.title: Boutique Warehouse Stay in Hobart’s Vibrant Salamanca Place
hotels.description: Tucked away inside original Georgian warehouses and spread across two buildings separated by a city block, Moss Hotel invites you to embrace the history and natural scenery of Tasmania. The hotel’s warehouse number 39, in the heart of Salamanca Place, puts you only steps from an array of dining and entertainment options, while at number 25 - located in a quieter spot, but still close to the action - privacy and intimacy reign supreme. From this luxury springboard, you’ll be perfectly placed to immerse yourself in the local culture. Hop aboard one of the regular MONA ferries, enjoy alfresco dinners, pop open the finest Tasmanian wines, taste your way through Saturday's Salamanca Market - starting with a local scallop pie - and discover Tasmania’s spectacular scenery on one of the many nearby hiking trails.

hotels.title: Central Hobart Self-Contained Studios and Apartments Near Salamanca Place & St David's Park
hotels.description: Experience the charm of Hobart with a stay at this ideally positioned escape between the city's vibrant waterfront and historic Battery Point. Spend relaxing hours in your spacious, self-contained apartment, complete with a kitchenette, comfortable living area and views of the city below. When you feel like stepping out, savour the finest Tasmanian produce at the nearby Salamanca Market, explore the captivating exhibits at the Museum of Old and New Art, or take a scenic drive to the stunning Mount Wellington.
